Launching Rentaflop – Render your Blender projects without sacrificing quality
text:
Hi HN, My name is David Sokol, and I'm the founder of rentaflop (https://rentaflop.com). We're a crowdsourced render farm aimed at making Blender rendering fast and affordable.

If you've used Blender, then I'm sure you've experienced the pain of waiting around for your animations to render. You've probably even had to sacrifice the quality of your work to reduce your render times. I've been there too.

Our solution to this dilemma is to leverage low opportunity cost hardware from around the world to allow Blender artists to render their projects quickly, affordably, and without compromising on quality. When artists need to create an animation, instead of lowering the quality of their work to reduce render times or paying thousands to buy or rent the hardware required, they can get fast and affordable rendering without compromising on quality.

We just wrapped up our beta and are now launching to the public! If you'd like to try us, check out our site (https://rentaflop.com) and render your Blender project quickly and affordably!

We posted about our beta on HN a few weeks ago. If you'd like, you can check out the discussion here (https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=32838673). These are some of the features we've added since last time: 1. Price calculator, allowing you to see exactly what you'll pay for a render and view sample frames to verify render correctness. 2. Blender versioned rendering, so you can choose from among several different Blender versions to render your project with. 3. File upload size limit raised to 1 GB, so you can now upload much larger projects than before. 4. Encrypted .blend files, giving you enhanced data privacy and protecting your IP during the rendering process.

Please leave a comment below, we'd love to hear your thoughts :)

Show HN: Jackdeez – the EZ way to configure jackd via dbus
text:
I always thought that qjackctl was WAY overkill for most of my jackd needs. I made a utility with gum[1] to simplify the process. Supports connecting/disconnecting ports, configuring driver/engine parameters, and midi pass-through enable.

[1]: https://github.com/charmbracelet/gum

Ask HN: Why do you hate (or love!?) your language's package manager?
text:
We're getting ready to design a package manager for Rel, the declarative relational language we're building at RelationalAI (https://relational.ai/). I know that building a package manager is a fraught task, and that people have very strong feelings about their package managers.

Why do you hate yours? What mistakes should we take care to avoid?

Or if you're one of the lucky few blessed with happy package management, what is it you love about yours?

Ask HN: A social app for remote workers/ nomads to buddy up for activities?
text:
Hey, I'd love your thoughts. I'm building an app which allows digital nomads and remote workers to find other people who share their interests, e.g., surfing, rock climbing, hiking. The search works based on location (near me or specific hub, e.g. Corralejo) or interest (surfing, cycling, etc.).

The goal is to find likeminded digital nomads/ remote workers online, ask questions on top spots for activities, and eventually buddy up for sport/ outdoor activities in real life instead of the usual drinks and social hangouts. It's about building a network as a nomad based on shared outdoor interests.

I find that as a remote worker if you move a lot it becomes hard to build and maintain a community, so thought an app like this could help.

What do you think? You can see the beta for free here: https://bit.ly/3zpF4Kq

Thanks!

title: Ask HN: Is remote work beneficial for neurodiverse individuals?
text:
I've been reading plenty of articles around remote work being very beneficial for neurodiverse individuals and am wondering what do people who identify as neurodiverse think about it. Anyone on here who identifies as neurodiverse and wants to comment? Is it remote work or remote work with specific adjustments?

And what about being a digital nomad (where you change locations on average every 3 - 6 months)? Any particular conditions that would think this is a big no go?

Curious.

Ask HN: How to deal with an a$$hole colleague?
text:
Ex-googler (sorry but it seems there's a pattern with these guys), neurotic, huge ego-issues, never apologizes, insulting and demeaning behavior, completely incapable of _exchanging_ views and a master of destructive criticism. That's my colleague (and team lead) in my new(ish) role.

The manager is doing nothing to control this a$$hole despite the matter being raised. Maybe he's startstruck by his googleyness or some other gaslighting technique of his.

Now, I'm at the verge of quitting because I'm getting tired of needing 2 days to decompress from 1 day at work. OTOH it is a bit fucked up to quit a job especially these days because of an incapable manager and an a$$hole colleague.

What's your experiences/views/proposals?

Show HN: Capture YouTube video screenshots (quick and easy API)
text:
A few months back I needed to display arbitrary images from YouTube videos in an app, but there was no easy way, so I built something to scratch my own itch.

Today, I publish an updated version of it, based on the feedback you gave. Now, you can also query for the length, thumbnail, title and description of a youtube video. You can try it out in your browser after getting API keys from Gumroad for free, using the link below.

https://abyesilyurt.gumroad.com/l/screenshot-api

Next, I will add image resolution query to resize the images. What other features would you like to see?
